quiz.question: What does 'What goes around comes around' imply?
Who is traditionally credited with authoring much of the Biblical Book of Proverbs?
Which rhetorical device is especially common in Biblical proverbs?
What is the meaning of 'Don't put all your eggs in one basket'?
Which poet wrote 'To err is human; to forgive, divine'?
Which rare label describes a proverb used as an argument in folk law or oral testimony?
Which proverb encourages starting early to gain advantage?
Which proverb teaches that small consistent efforts produce results?
Which proverb became a slogan in risk management advising not to rely on a single option?
Which proverb tells you to take action rather than only speak?
Which proverb is summarized by 'Less is more' in modern phrasing?
Which Roman leader uttered 'Alea iacta est' when crossing the Rubicon?
Which proverb does the fable 'The Ant and the Grasshopper' illustrate?
Which 18th-century poet wrote the line that inspired 'the best-laid plans of mice and men'?
